name: Booster Installation ITP

Boosters located in accordance with approved drawing & in accordance with AS2419
SAMFs approved hydrant values, hard suction & dual booster connectors fitted including pressure gauges
All above ground pipework securely fixed & plugged off & isolating valves closed & SAMFs required signage & block plans installed
Booster enclosure to be in accordance with SAMFs
Door hold open devices fitted & budget locks fitted as specified
Arrange for SAMFs to inspect fire booster assembly
Fire Extinguishers ITP
Fire extinguishers & signs installed in accordance with AS 2444 & applicable approved drawing
Arranged SAMFS to carry out inspection and verify quantity and location of extinguishers are acceptable
Fire Pumps ITP
Pumps & associated pipework installed in accordance with the approved drawings & AS2118. Pump room secure & lockable
Pump wiring installed in accordance with AS3000 & phase 3 & neutral power supply available
Fire water storage tank water supply available (suction) & all piping (discharge) & drains complete, pressure tested ready for use
Diesel engine filled with oil, fuel, batteries connected & diesel muffler & exhaust fitted to vent exhaust gases to atmosphere
Pump testing completed - detail any non-conformances below

Second Fix Pressure Test
Sprinkler seismic hanging systems to be installed to AS1170.4 & include engineers sign off & supporting documentation
Fire penetrations to be sealed in accordance with manufacturers tested system with the location indicated on as builts with labels - Please attach photos
Sprinkler head spacings & temperature ratings checked to comply with AS2118
Test Procedures
Connect air compressor to above ground pipework to be tested. Fill pipework with compressed air to 100kpa

Inspect above ground pipework for obvious leakage. Re-check pressure gauge and if no major pressure loss, pump up to 200kpa. Hold at 200kpa for 10 minutes. If no obvious air leakage from pipework being tested, release air pressure via control valve on compressor, and fill pipework with water to towns main pressure and set up TFP pressure test pump
Notify builders supervisor that fire services pipework is to be pressure tested
If no obvious loss of pressure pump switch on TFP pressure test pump and pump to 1600kpa and hold at this test pressure for at least two hours as specified
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below

Test Procedures
Review inspection details above to verify that all inspections are satisfactory and test procedures can now follows

Connect air compressor to above ground pipework to be tested. Fill pipework with compressed air to 100kpa. Inspect above ground pipework for obvious leakage. Re-check pressure gauge and if no major pressure loss, pump up to 200kpa
Hold at 200kpa for 10 minutes. If no obvious air leakage from pipework being tested, release air pressure via control valve on compressor, and fill pipework with water to towns main pressure
Connect pressure test pump to water filled section of pipework being tested. Pump to 1000kpa and hold pressure for 5 minutes
If no obvious loss of pressure, pump to 1500kpa. if no obvious loss of pressure pump to 1700kpa and hold at this test pressure for at least two hours
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
Hose Reels ITP
Installation
Fire hose reels and signs installed in accordance with AS2441
Fire hose reels and sign installed in accordance with applicable approved drawing
Hose guides and rollers installed where applicable
Packing tapes removed, hose vented, water flow checked at minimum flow rate of 20 litres per minute
Fire hose reel turns freely with no excessive force
Test Procedures
Confirm hose reel pipework has been inspected and pressure tested as per ITP for hose reel pipework
With water supply valve to hose reels open, run out hose reels to full length and flow hose reels at full flow
Check hose reel assembly for leaks and secure fixings. Shut off water supply valve and rewind hoses
Arrange for SAMFs to carry out inspection and flow test on each hose reel
Arrange for client to witness SAMFs tests
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
Fire Water Tanks ITP
Installation
Tank roof and walls assembled in accordance with approved jsa's, shop drawings and approved construction drawings
Tank liner Installed in accordance with manufacturers data sheets and instructions
Ensure all tank panels, roof sheets, anchor bolts for tank internal braces are tight and no debris is left inside tank
Ensure all external tank connection fittings, access ladders, manhole covers, tank contents level indicators and external wind braces (if fitted) are correctly installed, tight and operational
Vacuum out any debris from inside tank and check all fixings/bolts for tightness. re-fit external manhole cover to form confined space
Tank leak test complete
Test Procedures
Make a detailed inspection of external walls of tank to check for any sign of a leak
Check ladders and manhole covers to ensure easy access is possible
Check tank contents gauge and signage for correct operation
Check tank roof and flashings to ensure no sharp edges and roof flashings are vermin proof
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below

Continuity and polarity checks carried out on all cables
EWIS panel loudspeakers and WPIs installed in accordance with applicable approved drawings and AS1668, AS2036, AS1670, AS1603 and SAMFs requirements
Inspection carried out - Attached/Any relevant comments added below
Detail and corrective action for non-conformance Inspections
Test Procedures
Review inspection details above to verify that all inspections are satisfactory and test procedures can now follow
Ensure Client and Builders representative are aware that EWIS system is to be tested. Resulting in audible alarms
Set SAMFs signalling device to test position
Ensure all mechanical plant interface circuits are isolated or disconnected (Smoke spill fans, gas solenoid, etc)
Connect 240 volt power to EWIS and install sealed lead acid batteries
Isolate EWIS inputs from FIP and set EWIS to "manual" position
Test EWIS system in "manual" mode, check audibility of all loudspeakers
Check all WIPs for audible tone and clear speech
Ensure EWIS system provides correct DB requirements to all parts of the building by using hand held DB meter
Once initial audibility tests have been completed ,
Initiate "manual alert" for each floor and all floors
Then initiate "manual evacuate" for each floor and all floors
Once all above tests have been carried out, set EWIS system to “automatic” mode
Set output from FIP to EWIS to normal mode and simulate fire alarm on FIP
Check to ensure EWIS system automatically sounds the “alert” tone throughout the building and sounds “evacuate” tone on floor that initiated the simulated fire alarm
Once EWIS system has been tested on “manual” and “automatic” mode continue to test all wip’s from each floor to EWIS control panel and between floors
Between each and every WIP
Simulate mains power failure in order to prove automatic change over to back-up batteries. carry out load test with all devices connected in order to prove correct battery capacity
Arrange for client to Witness the two hour pressure test
Test of 6 EWIS zones and WIPs at random chosen by Client
Arrange formal SAMFs inspection and system testing
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
FINAL - Pass when happy to proceed with work(s) (Any issues please comment below)
Area left clean & tidy
Trojan Sign-Off (Add below)
Builder Sign-Off (Add below)
ITP4535-004 Fire Alarms
Installation
Confirm area of work is accessible & acceptable to commence
Attach Photos/Comments below if any issues & Send report to Builder
Relevant Drawing & Revision #
Wiring installed in accordance with AS3000, ETSA regulations, Telstra and Austel regulations
Continuity and polarity checks carried out on all cables

Detectors, bells, break glass alarms, automatic magnetic door holders, visual alarms, mimic panels, main FIP, data gathering panels all installed in accordance with applicable approved drawings and AS1668, AS2036, as1670,AS1603 and SAMFs requirements
Inspection carried out - Attached/Any relevant comments added below
Detail and corrective action for non-conformance Inspections
Test Procedures
Review inspection details above to verify that all inspections are satisfactory and test procedures can now follow
Ensure client and builders site representative are aware that fire alarm system is to be tested, resulting in audible alarms
Audible and visual alarms can be disconnected or isolated during test once they have been proved to be operational
Set SAMFs signalling device to test position
Ensure all mechanical plant interface circuits are isolated or disconnected (smoke spill fans, gas solenoid, etc)
Connect 240 volt power to FIP and install sealed lead acid batteries
Review FIP block plans against actual installation and ensure detector identification numbers are correctly shown
Test every single smoke detector and thermal detector by introducing smoke/heat from an approved test device. Ensure FIP is reset after each detector has gone into the alarm mode
Check to ensure above ceiling remote identification plates operate
Ensure alarm bells and visual device operate correctly, and that EWIS panel is activated as per zoned requirements
Test every single break glass alarm unit by using test key provided
Ensure FIP is reset after each break glass alarm has been activated. Test fire pump controls and indications
Test all outputs to BMS system with bms commissioning engineer in attendance. Test automatic/manual “stop/start” of smoke spill fans and fan status indicators
Test every single magnetic door hoding device and prove all unites to be fully operational
Test all auxiliary FIP outputs to mimic panels, EWIS system, gas solenooid valve, mechanical plant, SAMFs signalling device
Simulated mains power failure in order to prove automatic change over to back-up batteries
Carry out load test with all devices connected in order to prove correct battery capacity
Arrange client witness test
Test of 6 smoke detectors at random chosen by client
Arrange formal SAMFs inspection and system testing
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
FINAL - Pass when happy to proceed with work(s) (Any issues please comment below)
Area left clean & tidy

Pre Action System ITP
Installation - First Fix
Pipework installed in accordance with applicable TFP approved drawings
First fix pipework, hangers, seismic fixings, guards, air bleed vents, drain valves fitted in accordance with AS2118
First Fix Pressure Test
Installation - Second Fix
Second fix pipework, hangers, seismic fixings, guards, air bleed vents, drain valves fitted in accordance with AS2118
Second Fix Pressure Test
Sprinkler seismic hanging systems to be installed to AS1170.4 & include engineers sign off & supporting documentation
Fire penetrations to be sealed in accordance with manufacturers tested system with the location indicated on as builts with labels - Please attach photos
Sprinkler head spacings & temperature ratings checked to comply with AS2118
Test Procedures

Review inspection details above to verify that all inspections are satisfactory and test procedures can now follows. Ensure TFP chargehand carries out/supervises the pressure testing and remains with the TFP pressure test pump while tests are in progress. Do not allow TFP apprentices to carry out pressure testing without close supervision.
NOTE: Air testing is only required to be performed when there is a risk of water damage to finished floors or furnished buildings.

NOTE: LL requires 24 hours notice for water and 48 hour notice for air, this will be communicated in the builder’s brief. This has been added to swms. Provide schematics, pressure source location, pressure relief device, equipment used, calibration certificates that will be used are to be included in the ITP submission to the builder's brief.

NOTE: Ensure suitable warning signage is displayed at all entrances and exits to area of pressure testing being carried out stating “warning TFP pressure testing pipe work”. Notify builders foreman and supervisors that the relevant levels, risers or areas are being pressure tested.

Prior to using TFP mobile air compressor, ensure that the pre set 400kpa pressure relief valve has been fitted to the pipe work being tested as a fail safe of over pressurisation. Visually inspect the TFP air compressor being used for the test to ensure no damage to the compressor assembly and hoses. Check to ensure pressure gauge fitted to TFP test manifold is operational. Note, any air testing above 80kpa requires test plan approved by LL regional EHS manager.
Install TFP's certified pressure gauge with test certificate that is valid and in date to the system/area of pipe work being tested

Ensure TFP's air compressor test pump discharge/outlet connector is connected to the pipe work to be tested above/down stream of the main stop valve either using roll grove, gal mal screwed or high-pressure hoses.

Once all inspection/checks have been completed and TFP’s mobile air compressor test pump is connected, ensure pre action system main stop valve is closed, turn air compressor on and prove air is available. Open air compressor discharge/outlet valve and fill system to 100kpa, then close discharge/outlet valve. Visually walk the area under test to check for any air leaks.

If no obvious air leaks and pressure holding at 100kpa for a period of 20 minutes, open discharge/outlet valve on TFP's mobile air compressor test pump and pressurise to 300kpa or 1 and a 1/2 times system working pressure. Check area under test for any air leaks then hold required pressure for two hours. A TFP employee is to remain watching the testing for the entire duration.

After test completion ensure main stop valve is padlocked closed. Slowly reduce air pressure to 0 through the pre action system drain valve. Once pressure gauge is reading 0, disconnect TFP’s air compressor test pump from the pre action system and connect systems permanent air compressor ready for system simulation test.
Confirm pre action system solenoid operates on fire alarm in the protected area when smoked detector is forced into alarm with test smoke.

Ensuring the main stop valve is still in the closed position, re-pressurise the dry pipe pre action system with air utilising the permanent systems air compressor to its pre set systems working pressure of 200kpa of air. Then close systems down stream test valve above pre action valve set to prevent system being flooded with water. Open the main stop valve below pre action valve so system is primed and in its normal operational setting. Introduce smoke to simulate smoke detectors going into alarm and operating solenoid. Simulate a loss of air pressure through the pre action valve set drain valve, actuating the pre action system to operate and come into alarm.
Ensure TFP chargehand is supervising the pressure test at all times and inspects pipework while it is under test pressure. Arrange for client to witness the two-hour pressure test.
Sign-Off
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
